page.title: 04St Peter's Church
page.content: It was to the church that the Villagers fled for safety whenever there was trouble or an uprising.The main Church door is very strong, and was formerly secured by a strong timber pole.The recesses for this pole can be seen on either side of the door. In the early church there were no pews and the Nave would be used as the Village Hall for gatherings of all kinds, including being the "market-place" where produce from the land would be bartered or sold. The boards on the wall of the Cresacre Chapel give the details of various charities administered by the Church.Although today the sums of money seem very small, in the 18th and 19th centuries they would represent very substantial amounts.
